name: La Palma VolTrac
content:
Volcanic Activities of La Palma visualized onto the Liquid Galaxy.
La Palma Volcano Eruption Tracking Tool is an app built on the Flutter framework that allows the Visualization of various Tracks, such as Historic, Lava Flow, Affected Areas, Pre-historic, Landscape, Sulphur Dioxide Emissions, Situation, and Located Events map, for La Palmas onto the Liquid Galaxy.
The project presents multiple layers of information on the events that occurred in the eruption of the Cumbre Vieja volcano in La Palma during the fall of 2021.
Data such as the evolution of lava flows and many more are presented in a graphical and interactive way on the Liquid Galaxy platform, a visualization cluster based on Google Earth.
Further customizations are possible with the help of the Custom Builder, which has an interactive UX where the user can check the data he wants and visualize the Custom KML by providing start and end dates with the help of a calendar widget.
The Map screen UI is a perfect interaction tool for the panoramic display of Google Earth with the help of Google Maps, and it allows us to control the LG and send Orbit movements and various other controls.
The app shows essential information about the La Palma Volcanic activity in an elegant and user-friendly way.
It supports 10 Languages: Arabic, German, English, Spanish, Hindi, Japanese, Portuguese, Russian, Albanian, and Chinese (Simplified).
The app comes in both day and night modes, and one can 'tour' the app to get familiar with all the features.
Lastly, the app has an info tab that lists helpful information along with the sources so that one can use this app for research and education purposes.

This project has been started as a Google Summer of Code 2022 project with the Liquid Galaxy Organization, developed by
Yash Raj Bharti.
Lleida Liquid Galaxy LAB support: Pau Francino
Liquid Galaxy Org Director: Andreu Iba침ez
App released by Alejandro Ill치n Marcos

name: SatNOGS Visualization Tool
content:
View satellites and ground stations information from the SatNOGS database.
The project aims to collect and show data from satellites and ground stations using the SatNOGS database and API.
With the data available into the app, is possible to send it to the Liquid Galaxy system to be shown into Google Earth.
All this information is included in the SatNOGS (Satellite Networked Open Ground Station) database.
The ground stations are antennas that capture transmissions from satellites. Using this network, SatNOGS created a database with all the information captured since its creation. We will use this database to get the information we need, since it is open and free. It contains information about the satellites, the data received in the communication, the protocols of transmission accepted and more.
An important step to take is configure the slave screens for refreshing, otherwise the logos and the info balloon will not be visible. Follow the steps below to activate it:
1. With Google Earth opened, press CTRL+ALT+B on the keyboard or click on the VIEW tab on the tab bar and then Sidebar.
2. Into the Sidebar, expand the KML Sync folder.
3. Right click on the Solo KML folder and click on Properties.
4. Go to the Refresh tab and change the Time-Based Refresh to: Periodically | 0hrs | 0mins | 2secs
- The recommended secs if from 1 to 3 seconds.
- Click on OK and close the side bar by following the first step.

Done! Remember to do it for all slave screens so all of them will be reactive.

This project has been started as a Google Summer of Code 2022 project with the Liquid Galaxy Organization, developed by Michel Agarra Barros.
Lleida Liquid Galaxy LAB support: Pau Francino
Liquid Galaxy Org Director: Andreu Iba침ez
App released by Alejandro Ill치n Marcos

name: Rocket Launcher
content:
SpaceX API is used for data of all launch, starlink then visualises it on LG Rig.
This application harnesses the SpaceX API to access comprehensive data pertaining to all SpaceX launches, missions, and Starlink satellites deployments.
It serves the purpose of visualizing this data on a Liquid Galaxy Rig, effectively utilizing KML (Keyhole Markup Language) balloons to provide detailed information in a visually appealing manner.
Furthermore, it offers real-time tracking of Starlink satellites, furnishing users with the latest positional information.
The development of this application represents a significant milestone achieved under the Google Summer of Code 2023 project, a collaborative initiative with the esteemed Liquid Galaxy organization.
By adopting the Flutter framework, the application seamlessly integrates a modern, cross-platform user interface.
The core functionality of this application is twofold:
1. **SpaceX Data Visualization:**
- **Launch Data:** The application retrieves and visualizes data on all SpaceX launches, including key details such as launch dates, payloads, and launch sites.
- **Mission Information:** It also offers insights into various SpaceX missions, showcasing mission objectives, destinations, and progress.
- **Starlink Satellites:** Data pertaining to Starlink satellite deployments, including orbital parameters, constellation status, and launch history, is elegantly presented.
2. **Liquid Galaxy Integration:**
- **KML Balloons:** Utilizing KML balloons, the application generates immersive visual representations of SpaceX data. These balloons display relevant information in a manner that enhances user understanding and engagement.
- **Real-time Satellite Tracking:** A particularly noteworthy feature is the real-time tracking of Starlink satellites.
Users can monitor the precise location of these satellites as they traverse the Earth's orbit, thus gaining insight into the dynamic nature of satellite constellations.
- **SSH Connectivity:** The application employs a secure SSH client to establish a connection with the Liquid Galaxy Rig.
This connection facilitates seamless data transfer and control, enabling users to interact with the Liquid Galaxy display effortlessly.
By leveraging the Flutter framework, the application ensures cross-device compatibility, thereby extending its reach to a broad spectrum of users.
Its user-friendly interface enhances accessibility, making it an invaluable tool for space enthusiasts, researchers, and anyone interested in the SpaceX program.
In conclusion, this application represents a noteworthy achievement in the realm of space data visualization and interaction.
Its successful development during the Google Summer of Code 2023 project for Liquid Galaxy reflects a commitment to innovation and technological advancement, furthering our understanding of SpaceX missions and Starlink satellite deployments while providing a seamless user experience on the Liquid Galaxy Rig.
**Additional Info regarding data:**
This app only asks for credentials required to connect to LG and stores it locally using shared preferences along with selected theme data and language.
